# RichTextInput The rich text input component allows users to input and format text using a user friendly interface. Changing standard text inputs into fully featured edits, supporting formatting, linking, and embedding. ## Overview Rich text input is made of two parts, the input where users can add text, and a toolbar. This toolbar has been arranged to suit user's needs for text editing. ### Resources Deep dive into implementation details and access the Nimbus design library. [Slate.js Documentation](https://docs.slatejs.org/) [Figma library](https://www.figma.com/design/AvtPX6g7OGGCRvNlatGOIY/NIMBUS-design-system?node-id=7190-34429&m=dev) ## Variables Get familiar with the features. ### Toolbar features Users can change type styles, toggle bold, italics, underline, strikethrough, code sections, superscript, subscript, bullet points and numbered lists. Undo and redo buttons are icon buttons. ```jsx-live const App = () => { const [value, setValue] = React.useState("

Nimbus dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam component felis, vel consistency elementum. Sed design tokens ut turpis ac user experience maximus. Integer accessibility vitae nibh id clarity interface tincidunt.

"); return ( ); }; ``` ### Minimum and maximum height These can be fully configured as needed. Toolbar should remain sticky to the top of the input. Set the minimum height to ensure at least a few lines of content are visible. ```jsx-live const App = () => { const [value, setValue] = React.useState("

Nimbus dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam component felis, vel consistency elementum. Sed design tokens ut turpis ac user experience maximus. Integer accessibility vitae nibh id clarity interface tincidunt.

"); return ( ); }; ``` ## Guidelines These guidelines provide comprehensive direction for designing and developing rich text inputs within Nimbus. ### Best practices - **Make responsive changes:** Apply changes immediately to the selected text upon clicking a toolbar control. - **Utilize tooltips and labels:** Include tooltips for all toolbar actions to enhance discoverability and accessibility. - **Keep a user's focus:** Maintain the user's focus within the text area after an action or toggle is selected. - **Allow for common shortcuts:** Support standard keyboard shortcuts for formatting (e.g., Ctrl/Cmd+B for bold). - **Make it easier to correct mistakes:** Offer an undo/redo history for content changes, and allow for a large enough input window so a user can quickly read content without needing to scroll line by line. - **Tailor tooling:** Determine the required formatting options based on the user's needs for the specific application. - **Curate tools into meaningful similar collections:** Group related controls logically in the toolbar (e.g., text styling, lists, media). ## Usage Rich text inputs should be used in areas where a user knows that a longer response or description is expected. > [!TIP]\ > When to use - **Editing long-form content:** Such as product descriptions, knowledge base articles, or email bodies, where visual hierarchy and style are necessary for readability. - **Formatting text:** Such as applying bold, italics, underlines, or specific heading levels. - **Structuring content:** With bulleted or numbered lists. - **Embedding external elements:** Like links, images, or videos within other content. > [!CAUTION]\ > When not to use - **Short answers:** Or single-line inputs, such as names, titles, or search queries. - **Specific data entry:** Unformatted text is required, like SKUs, passwords, or simple codes. - **Plain text communication:** Such as chat messages or comments, where formatting options can clutter the interface or distract from the conversation. - **Inputs that need to be strictly controlled:** Where the application's style guide should be the only source of formatting (e.g., when there is passing through of styling and content to another site). ### Rich text input in use > [!TIP]\ > **Do** > > - Do use tooltips for tools represented by icons. In the case of paragraph > styles show the style in the dropdown, not just stated in plain text. > - Do provide more height for the input to see a few lines of text and reduce > scrolling. > - Do utilize an undo and redo button to assist a user with writing and editing > text when possible. ![Do](/images/rich-text-input/rich-text-input-do.png) > [!CAUTION]\ > **Don't** > > - Don't make the input so small that you cannot easily see a few lines of > text. > - Don't move the rich text toolbar to sit on the bottom of the input. > - Don't overload the rich text toolbar with tools that are unnecessary. ![Don't](/images/rich-text-input/rich-text-input-dont.png) ## Specs ## Accessibility Accessibility ensures that digital content and functionality are usable by everyone, including people with disabilities, by addressing visual, auditory, cognitive, and physical limitations. ### Accessibility standards ```jsx-live const App = () => { const [value, setValue] = React.useState(""); return ( ); }; ``` - **Semantic Markup:** Ensure the editor outputs semantic HTML (e.g., `

`, `
    `, ``) to be correctly interpreted by screen readers. - **Keyboard Access:** Ensure all toolbar controls are accessible via the tab key. Users must be able to navigate and apply formatting without a mouse. - **ARIA:** Apply appropriate ARIA attributes to the toolbar and its controls, such as `aria-label` for toggle icon buttons.
